org.kepler.util.sql

Class DatabaseType

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.util.sql.DatabaseType
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HSQL, MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL

    public abstract class DatabaseType
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility routines for accessing SQL databases. It cannot be directly instantiated: it has several abstract methods that must be implemented for a specific database engine such as MySQL.
    Author:
    Daniel Crawl

        Parameters:

      • getPrepStatement

        public java.sql.PreparedStatement getPrepStatement(java.lang.String str)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get a PreparedStatement from an SQL string. All PreparedStatements returned by this method are closed when disconnect() is called. NOTE: this method returns different PreparedStatements when called with the same SQL statement so that they may be executed in parallel.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

                                        throws java.sql.SQLException

      • getSQLSelect

        public java.sql.PreparedStatement getSQLSelect(java.lang.String tableName,
                                               java.lang.String columnNames,
                                               java.lang.String conditions)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create a PreparedStatement for an SQL SELECT.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to query
        columnNames - a comma-separated list of columns to query
        conditions - a list of one or more conditions specified in SQL. use "?" to specify parameters to the prepared statement. this is optional and may be null.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • insert

        public int insert(java.sql.PreparedStatement prepStmt,
                  java.lang.String tableName,
                  java.lang.String incName)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Execute a prepared statement that returns an auto-incremented key. NOTE: if the DatabaseType needs to 'call IDENTITY()' to get the auto-incremented key, then all calls that update the database need to be synchronized with the DatabaseType object's intrinsic lock. If this is not done, another thread could update a different table while this method is called and the result of 'call IDENTITY()' will be for that table instead of the one for this method.
        Parameters:
        prepStmt - PreparedStatement to be executed
        tableName - the table name
        incName - the name of the auto-incremented column
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        public boolean needAbsolutePathForName()

                                                   boolean allowNullable)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get the SQL definition of a column.
        Parameters:
        column - the column
        allowNullable - If true and the column can be null, then the returned definition contains the nullable constraint.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
